title: 15 Best Chrome Extensions for Designers
short: Awesome Google Chrome extensions for designers!
body: Google Chrome reigns supreme as the most popular browser for desktop and mobile devices. So it goes without saying that it's used by multitudes of designers and developers. It is well known for an abundance of optional extensions, plugins and add-ons, that have been developed within the community. These extensions can greatly help us boost our daily productivity! We’ve collected 15 of the best Google Chrome extensions to help your design process. Enjoy! ## Muzli Muzli delivers expertly curated design inspiration, UI, UX and interactive news and shots from around the web. It's a true must-have for creatives! Check out [Muzli](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/muzli-2-stay-inspired/glcipcfhmopcgidicgdociohdoicpdfc). ## Loom Loom helps you record animations, user-flows, or bugs and share them with your team. It's a highly useful extension that also happens to be free! Check out [Loom](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/loom-for-chrome/liecbddmkiiihnedobmlmillhodjkdmb). ## Toybox Toybox is an extremely useful tool for quickly inspecting the CSS of your website. It also allows you to leave feedback, take screenshots (automatically), record browser data, OS info, viewport size and more — making reproducing issues a breeze. Check out [Toybox](https://www.toyboxsystems.com/). ## WhatFont Whatfont helps you to quickly identify what font used on a website. It gives you a ton of information like font name, weight and size. Check out [WhatFont](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/whatfont/jabopobgcpjmedljpbcaablpmlmfcogm). ## Grammerly Grammarly improves your writing skills & edits your writing as you go. It gives suggestions for passive voice, active voice, commas, and grammar mistakes, and more. It's an invaluable tool when writing grammatically correct copy. Check out [Grammerly](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/grammarly-for-chrome/kbfnbcaeplbcioakkpcpgfkobkghlhen?hl=en). ## Dark Reader Dark reader will give any website that you visit a dark theme. When you're working long hours into the night it'll be much easier on your eyes, plus it'll help save battery life on your laptop! Check out [Dark Reader](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/dark-reader/eimadpbcbfnmbkopoojfekhnkhdbieeh). ## LastPass LastPass is a well-known password manager that works across a range of devices and platforms. It securely saves your important passwords and notes. If you work with a range of clients and need to remember lots of passwords - it's highly useful. Check out [LastPass](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/lastpass-free-password-ma/hdokiejnpimakedhajhdlcegeplioahd). ## ColorPick Eyedropper ColorPick Eyedropper is a tool that let's you easily pick out a color from a website. It gives you the complete color code information. And even has a magnification option to let you pick the exact color you want. Check out [](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/grammarly-for-chrome/kbfnbcaeplbcioakkpcpgfkobkghlhen?hl=en)[ColorPick](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/colorpick-eyedropper/ohcpnigalekghcmgcdcenkpelffpdolg). ## CSS Peeper CSS peeper is visual version of the chrome developer tools. It's great for designers looking to quickly & easily inspect the CSS from a website. Check out [CSS Peeper](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/css-peeper/mbnbehikldjhnfehhnaidhjhoofhpehk). ## UX Check UX Check helps designers identify the usability issues on a website using heuristic evaluation. You're also able to annotate and download UI elements. Plus create custom heuristic lists and run evaluations. Check out [UX Check](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/ux-check/giekhiebdpmljgchjojblnekkcgpdobp). ## Site Palette A handy browser extension to generate comprehensive color palettes. It's another must-have tool for designers and frontend developers looking for free colour scheme extraction! Check out [Site Palette](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/site-palette/pekhihjiehdafocefoimckjpbkegknoh). ## SVG Export SVG Export is a useful tool that scans websites for SVGs. It then lets you export them as PNGs, JPEGs or SVGs. Check out [Grammerly](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/grammarly-for-chrome/kbfnbcaeplbcioakkpcpgfkobkghlhen?hl=en). ## Full Page Screen Capture The simplest way to take a full page screenshot of your current browser window! Simply click the extension icon and the entire page will be screen captured! Then you can download it as an image or PDF. Check out [Full Page Screen Capture](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/full-page-screen-capture/fdpohaocaechififmbbbbbknoalclacl). ## Image Downloader This handy extension shows all images on a web page, and lets you select which ones you want to download. Check out [Image Downloader](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/image-downloader/cnpniohnfphhjihaiiggeabnkjhpaldj). ## Evernote Web Clipper The Evernote Web Clipper lets you easily save anything you see online—including text, links and images—into your Evernote account with a single click. It's great for collecting design inspiration & keeping it all in one place! Check out [Evernote Web Clipper](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/evernote-web-clipper/pioclpoplcdbaefihamjohnefbikjilc). ## Related Posts: * [18 Awesome 3D UI Design Examples](https://www.easeout.co/blog/2020-06-09-18-awesome-3d-ui-design-examples) * [25 Top Neumorphism UI Design Examples](https://www.easeout.co/blog/2020-03-27-25-top-neumorphism-ui-design-examples) * [25 Dark Mode UI Design Examples](https://www.easeout.co/blog/2020-05-13-25-dark-mode-ui-design-examples)
